issue.title: Buildiso PPC64LE Enablement
issue.body:
## Description

Enable ppc64(le) buildiso artifacts. The approach is to use grub, built by ``cobbler mkloaders``, to run the installation.

The buildiso directory is prepared with a `ppc/bootinfo.txt` that boots `/boot/grub.elf`, the location grub is copied too.

Additionally this fixes a problem detected after `utils.copyfile` was moved to `filesystem_helpers.copyfile`.

## Category

This is related to a:

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Packaging
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Code Quality
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Miscellaneous

## Tests

- [ ] Unit-Tests were created
- [x] System-Tests were created
- [ ] Code is already covered by Unit-Tests
- [ ] Code is already covered by System-Tests
- [ ] No tests required

pull_request.title: Buildiso PPC64LE Enablement
pull_request.body:
## Description

Enable ppc64(le) buildiso artifacts. The approach is to use grub, built by ``cobbler mkloaders``, to run the installation.

The buildiso directory is prepared with a `ppc/bootinfo.txt` that boots `/boot/grub.elf`, the location grub is copied too.

Additionally this fixes a problem detected after `utils.copyfile` was moved to `filesystem_helpers.copyfile`.

## Category

This is related to a:

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Packaging
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Code Quality
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Miscellaneous

## Tests

- [ ] Unit-Tests were created
- [x] System-Tests were created
- [ ] Code is already covered by Unit-Tests
- [ ] Code is already covered by System-Tests
- [ ] No tests required

issue.title: Cobbler 3.3.3 - Cobbler Yum Repo 'cobbler-config.repo' missing on deployed OS:  "could not read repo source"
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When Deploying AlmaLinux 8 or 9 via Kickstart / Autoinstall, the kickstart file references the following: 

`$yum_config_stanza`

And what this ends up translating too is:
curl "http://$IP_ADDRESS_OF_COBBLER_SERVER/cblr/svc/op/yum/profile/$COBBLER_PROFILE" --output /etc/yum.repos.d/cobbler-config.repo

However, when running a 'curl' on this URL, it produces the following:

```
error: could not read repo source: /distro_mirror/config/almalinux88-x86_64-0.repo
error: could not read repo source: /distro_mirror/config/almalinux88-x86_64-1.repo
```


When I 'cat' the output of the files that its meant to be downloading I see the following: 

```
$ cat /var/www/cobbler/distro_mirror/config/almalinux88-x86_64-0.repo
[core-0]
name=core-0
baseurl=http://@@http_server@@/cobbler/distro_mirror/almalinux88-x86_64/AppStream
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
priority=$yum_distro_priority



$ cat /var/www/cobbler/distro_mirror/config/almalinux88-x86_64-1.repo 
[core-1]
name=core-1
baseurl=http://@@http_server@@/cobbler/distro_mirror/almalinux88-x86_64/BaseOS
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
priority=$yum_distro_priority
```

This is not a filesystem permission issue.  This is a Cobbler issue.

How can I resolve this?

### Steps to reproduce

1.
2.
3.

### Expected behavior

It should print the 'yum' repo file

### Cobbler version


````
Cobbler 3.3.3
  source: ?, ?
  build time: Tue Jun 14 00:00:00 2022

````

### Operating system

AlmaLinux 9.2
cobbler-3.3.3-1.el9.noarch


### Cobbler log

<!--- Paste (partial) output from `/var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log` -->
````paste below
````

### Screenshots
![image](https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/assets/684506/14174c41-69c8-4f0c-8dee-a74c10b0b977)


### Additional information

This works in Cobbler 2.8.5

issue.title: invalid value for 'inst.rep' $tree
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

<!--- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
OS Installation stops with  warnings "invalid value for 'inst.rep' $tree" and "/dev/root does not exit"

<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### Steps to reproduce

the content of `/var/lib/tftpboot/pxelinux.cfg/default` generated by cobbler is 

> DEFAULT menu

> PROMPT 0
> MENU TITLE Cobbler | https://cobbler.github.io
> TIMEOUT 200
> TOTALTIMEOUT 6000
> ONTIMEOUT local
> 
> LABEL local
>         MENU LABEL (local)
>         MENU DEFAULT
>         LOCALBOOT -1
> 
> LABEL centos7.9-x86_64
>         MENU LABEL centos7.9-x86_64
>         kernel /images/centos7.9-x86_64/vmlinuz
>         append initrd=/images/centos7.9-x86_64/initrd.img  kssendmac inst.ks=http://192.168.100.123:8080/cblr/svc/op/autoinstall/profile/centos7.9-x86_64
>         ipappend 2
> MENU end

if i manually add 
`inst.repo="http://192.168.100.123:8080/cblr/distro_mirror/centos7.9"` after the 'initrd.img'
the installation will continue.
### Expected behavior

<!--- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
i remember that inst.repo is  generated by cobbler automatically in 2.x version. 

### Cobbler version
3.3.3
<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````paste below
````

### Operating system

<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->
fedora 38
### Cobbler log

<!--- Paste (partial) output from `/var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log` -->
````paste below
````

### Screenshots

<!--- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->
![截图_virt-manager_20230427134528](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5778894/234777045-b9995f3b-b2bf-4941-b7e9-5a61b6b93b33.png)

![截图_选择区域_20230427134653](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5778894/234772218-b77627c3-c309-4eae-a3f2-8dc82fff2e9a.png)

### Additional information

<!--- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

comment.body:
Hi,  
Sorry.  I filed another bug and Workaround at:
https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/issues/3493

issue.title: Cobbler 3.3.3-1.el9 "url --url=$tree" Kickstart/Autoinstall file problem and workaround
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hey Folks and @SchoolGuy , I hope you're doing well.  Thanks for all that you're doing with Cobbler.
I've migrated from Cobbler 2.8.5 on CentOS 7.9 to Cobbler 3.3.3-1.el9 on AlmalLinux 9.2

Cobbler 2.8.5. was super stable.
Cobbler 3.3.3 has a number of issues and I'll start filing some bugs

(What I'd like to do is publish a modern Cobbler Tutorial Series)

BUG:

I have a Kickstart file (both for AlmaLinux 8 and AlmaLinux 9) with the following line: 
`url --url=$tree`

However, the variable '$tree' never gets its value substituted as a result, the PXE installation fails with the following message:

dracut-initqueue: Warning: Invalid value for 'inst.repo': $tree

![image](https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/assets/684506/075c9104-73bc-4e3b-b637-2d71aa3e7c3b)

As a result, it  cannot find the RPM tree to do a Kickstart installation


I found out that it wasn't substituting the variable by running the 'get-autoinstall' script:
`cobbler profile get-autoinstall --name $ProfileName`

**The workaround is to change the value for 'url --url=$xyz**

I changed:
url --url=$tree

to

url --url=http://$IP_ADDRESS_OF_COBBLER_SERVER/cblr/links/$DISTRO_NAME_IN_COBBLER




### Steps to reproduce

1. Download the Distro:

mkdir /distros
cd /distros
wget http://mirror.myaccess.ca/8.8/isos/x86_64/AlmaLinux-8.8-x86_64-dvd.iso
mount -o loop /distros/AlmaLinux-8.8-x86_64-dvd.iso /mnt
cobbler import --path=/mnt --name=almalinux88-x86_64
umount /mnt
rm AlmaLinux-8.8-x86_64-dvd.iso

2. Do all your /etc/cobbler/* configurations
3. Create the Kickstart / Autoinstall file: /var/lib/cobbler/templates/almalinux8-cobbler-install.ks 

```
# Sample kickstart file for current EL, Fedora based distributions.

#platform=x86, AMD64, or Intel EM64T
# System authorization information
authselect  --useshadow  --enablemd5
# System bootloader configuration
bootloader --location=mbr
# Partition clearing information
clearpart --all --initlabel
# Use text mode install
text
# Firewall configuration
firewall --enabled
# Run the Setup Agent on first boot
firstboot --disable
# System keyboard
keyboard us
# System language
lang en_US
# Use network installation
url --url=$tree
# If any cobbler repo definitions were referenced in the kickstart profile, include them here.
$yum_repo_stanza
# Network information
$SNIPPET('network_config')
# Reboot after installation
reboot

#Root password
rootpw --iscrypted $default_password_crypted
# SELinux configuration
selinux --disabled
# Do not configure the X Window System
skipx
# System timezone
timezone  America/Vancouver --isUtc
# Clear the Master Boot Record
zerombr
# Allow anaconda to partition the system as needed
autopart

%pre
$SNIPPET('log_ks_pre')
$SNIPPET('autoinstall_start')
$SNIPPET('pre_install_network_config')
# Enable installation monitoring
$SNIPPET('pre_anamon')
%end


%packages
@^minimal-environment
kexec-tools
%end


%post --nochroot
$SNIPPET('log_ks_post_nochroot')
%end

%post
$SNIPPET('log_ks_post')
# Start yum configuration
$yum_config_stanza
# End yum configuration
$SNIPPET('post_install_kernel_options')
$SNIPPET('post_install_network_config')
$SNIPPET('download_config_files')
$SNIPPET('koan_environment')
$SNIPPET('redhat_register')
$SNIPPET('cobbler_register')
# Enable post-install boot notification
$SNIPPET('post_anamon')
# Start final steps
$SNIPPET('autoinstall_done')
# End final steps
%end
```

4. Create a Cobbler Profile for the AlmaLinux 8 distor and this kickstart file:

cobbler profile add --name=almalinux8-cobbler-install --distro=almalinux88-x86_64 --autoinstall=almalinux8-cobbler-install.ks

5. run 'cobbler sync'
6. Create a VM and start to PXE boot off the profil e

At this point, you will see this error.

### Expected behavior

It should kickstart AlmaLinux 8

### Cobbler version

<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````cobbler version
Cobbler 3.3.3
  source: ?, ?
  build time: Tue Jun 14 00:00:00 2022

````

### Operating system

<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->
cat /etc/almalinux-release 
AlmaLinux release 9.2 (Turquoise Kodkod)

### Cobbler log

The logs was massive so I searched for the string 'tree' and maybe this is whats relevant (?): 

<!--- Paste (partial) output from `/var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log` -->
````
[{'code': 'VFFSL(SL,"tree",True)',
  'exc_val': NotFound("cannot find 'tree'"),
  'lineCol': (23, 12),
  'rawCode': '$tree',
  'time': 'Thu Oct 26 14:53:02 2023'}]


````

### Screenshots



### Additional information

<!--- Add any other context about the problem here. -->


**RESOLUTION / workaround is to change the value for 'url --url=$xyz**

I changed:
`url --url=$tree
`
to

`url --url=http://$IP_ADDRESS_OF_COBBLER_SERVER/cblr/links/$DISTRO_NAME_IN_COBBLER`

issue.title: Cobbler 3.3.3-1.el9 "url --url=$tree" Kickstart/Autoinstall file problem and workaround
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hey Folks and @SchoolGuy , I hope you're doing well.  Thanks for all that you're doing with Cobbler.
I've migrated from Cobbler 2.8.5 on CentOS 7.9 to Cobbler 3.3.3-1.el9 on AlmalLinux 9.2

Cobbler 2.8.5. was super stable.
Cobbler 3.3.3 has a number of issues and I'll start filing some bugs

BUG:

I have a Kickstart file (both for AlmaLinux 8 and AlmaLinux 9) with the following line:

However, the variable '$tree' never gets its value substituted as a result, the PXE installation fails with the following message:

dracut-initqueue: Warning: Invalid value for 'inst.repo': $tree

![image](https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/assets/684506/075c9104-73bc-4e3b-b637-2d71aa3e7c3b)

As a result, it  cannot find the RPM tree to do a Kickstart installation


I found out that it wasn't substituting the variable by running the 'get-autoinstall' script:
`cobbler profile get-autoinstall --name $ProfileName`

**The workaround is to change the value for 'url --url=$xyz**

I changed:
url --url=$tree

to

url --url=http://$IP_ADDRESS_OF_COBBLER_SERVER/cblr/links/$DISTRO_NAME_IN_COBBLER




### Steps to reproduce

1. Download the Distro:

mkdir /distros
cd /distros
wget http://mirror.myaccess.ca/8.8/isos/x86_64/AlmaLinux-8.8-x86_64-dvd.iso

```
$SNIPPET('pre_anamon')
%end


%packages
@^minimal-environment
kexec-tools
%end


%post --nochroot
$SNIPPET('log_ks_post_nochroot')
%end

%post

# Start yum configuration
$yum_config_stanza
# End yum configuration
$SNIPPET('post_install_kernel_options')
$SNIPPET('post_install_network_config')
$SNIPPET('download_config_files')
$SNIPPET('koan_environment')
$SNIPPET('redhat_register')
$SNIPPET('cobbler_register')
# Enable post-install boot notification
$SNIPPET('post_anamon')
# Start final steps
$SNIPPET('autoinstall_done')
# End final steps
%end
```

4. Create a Cobbler Profile for the AlmaLinux 8 distor and this kickstart file:

cobbler profile add --name=almalinux8-cobbler-install --distro=almalinux88-x86_64 --autoinstall=almalinux8-cobbler-install.ks

At this point, you will see this error.

### Expected behavior

### Cobbler version

````cobbler version
Cobbler 3.3.3
````

issue.title: Ubuntu 22.04 template on cobbler 3.2.2
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

<!--- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Hello. I have cobbler version 3.2.2 installed and I'm using the web interface. In the signature file I see that Ubuntu22.04 appeared from version 3: https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler.github.io/tree/main/signatures
The template from Ubuntu 20 is not suitable. Do you have a template for installing Ubuntu 22.04? Or what is the difference between them?
<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### Cobbler version

<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````
Cobbler 3.2.2
````
### Operating system
CentOS Stream release 8

<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->

comment.body:
For Ubuntu support please follow this issue: https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/issues/3218

Ubuntu 22.04 support will not land in Cobbler 3.2.x and will only be available in Cobbler 3.4.x and forward. A backport is not possible due to incompatible API changes.

issue.title: Impossible to use proxy settings in cobbler config for "signature update"
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

<!--- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

It is impossible to use a proxy when attempting to run `cobbler signature update`(and potentially other commands that might interact with the proxy setting `proxy_url_ext` from the cobbler config) because of a conflict of the config schema and the way that the code uses the proxy variable.

<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### Steps to reproduce

1. set `proxy_url_ext` variable to a valid proxy string(for instance "http://127.0.0.1:3128")
2. run `cobbler signature update`

### Expected behavior

The command should successfully run without throwing an exception from within the requests library.

<!--- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

### Cobbler version

<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````paste below
Cobbler 3.4.0
  source: ?, ?
  build time: Wed Oct 19 09:35:00 2022
````

Please note that this is a custom build from a git commit f6bc81367d49a0b1f76b3af64af4ef0d496166ec.

### Operating system

Ubuntu 22.04

<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->

### Cobbler log

<!--- Paste (partial) output from `/var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log` -->
````paste below
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]: INFO | start_task(sigupdate); event_id(2022-11-15_162014_Updating Signatures_e917e570bf834ba08dc2fb35039a2cad)
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]: INFO | Exception occurred: <class 'AttributeError'>
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]: INFO | Exception value: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]: INFO | Exception Info:
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/cobbler/api.py", line 1563, in signature_update
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     sigjson = dlmgr.urlread(url)
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/cobbler/download_manager.py", line 40, in urlread
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     return requests.get(url, proxies=proxies, cert=cert)
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/requests/api.py", line 76, in get
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     return request('get', url, params=params, **kwargs)
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/requests/api.py", line 61, in request
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs)
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 532, in request
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     settings = self.merge_environment_settings(
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 710, in merge_environment_settings
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]:     no_proxy = proxies.get('no_proxy') if proxies is not None else None
Nov 15 16:20:14 my_server.local cobblerd[7068]: INFO | ### TASK COMPLETE ###
````

### Additional information

This issue stems from the fact that the config schema requires the `proxy_url_ext` field to be a string, and then it is loaded without any other processing inside the `DownloadManager` class from the loaded YAML config.
This value is then passed into requests as-is(a string, as per requirement of the schema) since the instance of `DownloadManager` in "api.py" does not use the `proxies` parameter.
Requests since at least version 1.0.4(oldest documentation that they host on their page) requires that the `proxies` parameter be a dictionary, but the `self.proxies` is a string so requests just raises an exception from within its internals when trying to call `.get` on the passed string.

We tried to set the `proxy_url_ext` variable to a format that would be loaded into proper structure but the schema defined for the config file will then raise an exception stating that the field must be a string.

comment.body: I think this issue is a duplicate of this (or vice versa): https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/issues/2472

issue.title: Cobbler should work with external proxy
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Unable to use commands such as "cobbler get-loaders" or "cobbler signature update" while using proxy in  /etc/cobbler/settings

<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### To Reproduce

1. Go to /etc/cobbler/settings and reference external proxy ` proxy_url_ext: "http://my.proxy.fr:port"`
2. Restart cobblerd and do `cobbler sync` 
3. Do `cobbler get-loaders`
4. Error occured without updating loaders (see screenshot attached)
[error.txt](https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/files/5696118/error.txt)
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72204474/102219960-77e49e80-3ee0-11eb-9b8d-e23e66ec7be0.PNG)


### Expected behavior

Loaders get updated without error

### Version

Cobbler version : 
`Cobbler 3.2.0
  source: b'62b51194', b'Wed Dec 9 11:59:41 2020 +0100'
  build time: Tue Dec 15 10:31:55 2020`


Python Version :
`Python 3.7.3`

### Screenshots

<!--- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

### Additional context

<!--- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

comment.body:
I'm also being blocked by this error.
`cobbler.download_manager.DownloadManager` seems to expect a dictionary of `{http: "<address>", https: "<address>"}` for the proxies: https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/blob/67d05ce5b07435390140f724038b910045c6a095/cobbler/download_manager.py#L32

While `settings.validate_settings()` expects a string: https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/blob/67d05ce5b07435390140f724038b910045c6a095/cobbler/settings/migrations/V3_3_0.py#L186

Should be a small fix.

Perhaps there is a workaround to force a HTTP proxy onto the cobbler service (or any executable).
This is a showstopper otherwise, I won't be able to use cobbler then.

Traceback from the service log:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/schema.py", line 394, in validate
    nvalue = Schema(svalue, error=e, ignore_extra_keys=i).validate(value)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/schema.py", line 429, in validate
    raise SchemaUnexpectedTypeError(message, e)
schema.SchemaUnexpectedTypeError: {'http': 'http://my-proxy:3128'} should be instance of 'str'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/api.py", line 147, in __generate_settings
    normalized_settings = settings.validate_settings(yaml_dict)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/settings/__init__.py", line 280, in validate_settings
    return migrations.normalize(settings_content)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/settings/migrations/__init__.py", line 291, in normalize
    return VERSION_LIST[version].normalize(settings)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/settings/migrations/V3_3_2.py", line 36, in normalize
    return schema.validate(settings)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/schema.py", line 398, in validate
    raise SchemaError([message] + x.autos, [e] + x.errors)
schema.SchemaError: Key 'proxy_url_ext' error:
{'http': 'http://my-proxy:3128'} should be instance of 'str'
The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/cobblerd", line 92, in main
    execute_settings_automigration=options.automigration)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/api.py", line 91, in __init__
    execute_settings_automigration)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cobbler/api.py", line 150, in __generate_settings
    from error
```

issue.title: Fix Windows UEFI
issue.body:
## Linked Items

Fixes #3473

<!-- A PR without an issue that is fixed might be merged at a later point in time. --> 

## Description

Fixes an issue with Windows UEFI + Docs + small fixes

## Behaviour changes

Old: <!-- This is the old way Cobbler behaved -->
 - BCD: Windows Boot Application (13200003)
 - BCD: Timeout: 30

New: <!-- This is the new way Cobbler behaves -->
- BCD: Windows Boot Loader
- BCD: add Path: \windows\system32\winload.exe
 - description of the sync_post_wingen.py trigger is documented
 - BCD Tiimeout: 0
 - fix: os_version must be in lowercase
 - fix: non-standard distro directory in distro_mirror
 - fix: path for winpe.wim in case of using wimboot

## Category

This is related to a:

- [X] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Packaging
- [X] Docs
- [ ] Code Quality
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Miscellaneous

## Tests

- [ ] Unit-Tests were created
- [ ] System-Tests were created
- [ ] Code is already covered by Unit-Tests
- [ ] Code is already covered by System-Tests
- [ ] No tests required 

<!--
If there are no tests already existing, and you don't want to create them it might be that your PR is only merged after
the maintainer team has added tests for said functionality.
-->

issue.title: cobbler is not installable in Ubuntu 22.04.3
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

<!--- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

cobbler is not installable in Ubuntu 22.04.3

I saw a ticket is logged here:
https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler/issues/3413, and PR has been merged.

so my question is:
a. when could the fix take effect?
b. when could I install cobbler via 'apt install'?

<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### Steps to reproduce

1.  update apt source:
```
root@usandbox:~# apt update
Hit:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease
Hit:2 https://artifacts.elastic.co/packages/7.x/apt stable InRelease
Get:3 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates InRelease [119 kB]
Hit:4 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-backports InRelease
Get:5 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security InRelease [110 kB]
Get:6 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security/main amd64 Packages [802 kB]
Get:7 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security/main Translation-en [169 kB]
Fetched 1200 kB in 10s (125 kB/s)
```
2. search cobbler, the command gives no output.
```
root@usandbox:~# apt-cache search cobbler
root@usandbox:~#
```

3. try install
```
root@usandbox:~# apt install cobbler
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package cobbler
```

### Expected behavior

<!--- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

### Cobbler version

<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````paste below
````

### Operating system
<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->
root@usandbox:~# lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
Release:	22.04
Codename:	jammy

### Cobbler log
N/A
<!--- Paste (partial) output from `/var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log` -->
````paste below
````

### Screenshots

<!--- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

### Additional information

<!--- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
here is my source.list file:
```
root@usandbox:~# cat /etc/apt/sources.list
# See http://help.ubuntu.com/community/UpgradeNotes for how to upgrade to
# newer versions of the distribution.
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy main restricted
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy main restricted

## Major bug fix updates produced after the final release of the
## distribution.
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates main restricted
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates main restricted

## N.B. software from this repository is ENTIRELY UNSUPPORTED by the Ubuntu
## team. Also, please note that software in universe WILL NOT receive any
## review or updates from the Ubuntu security team.
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy universe
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy universe
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates universe
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates universe

## N.B. software from this repository is ENTIRELY UNSUPPORTED by the Ubuntu
## team, and may not be under a free licence. Please satisfy yourself as to
## your rights to use the software. Also, please note that software in
## multiverse WILL NOT receive any review or updates from the Ubuntu
## security team.
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy multiverse
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy multiverse
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates multiverse
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates multiverse

## N.B. software from this repository may not have been tested as
## extensively as that contained in the main release, although it includes
## newer versions of some applications which may provide useful features.
## Also, please note that software in backports WILL NOT receive any review
## or updates from the Ubuntu security team.
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-backports main restricted universe multiverse
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-backports main restricted universe multiverse

deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security main restricted
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security main restricted
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security universe
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security universe
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security multiverse
# deb-src http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security multiverse
```

comment.body:
@coldbloodx The official community repository is located at: https://build.opensuse.org/project/show/systemsmanagement:cobbler

This project has Subprojects that are created for each release series. I am in the process of filling those repositories up so there are easier usable. :)

issue.title: Ubuntu 22.04 template on cobbler 3.2.2
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

<!--- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Hello. I have cobbler version 3.2.2 installed and I'm using the web interface. In the signature file I see that Ubuntu22.04 appeared from version 3: https://github.com/cobbler/cobbler.github.io/tree/main/signatures
The template from Ubuntu 20 is not suitable. Do you have a template for installing Ubuntu 22.04? Or what is the difference between them?
<!--- HINT: You can paste gist.github.com links for long logs or larger files -->

### Cobbler version

<!--- Paste output from `cobbler version` -->
````
Cobbler 3.2.2
````
### Operating system
CentOS Stream release 8

<!--- On which operating system do you use Cobbler? -->

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ menuentry "local" --class gnu-linux --class gnu --class os {
       chainloader /efi/opensuse/grub.efi
     elif [ -f /efi/sles/shim.efi ] ; then
       chainloader /efi/sles/grub.efi
+    elif [ -f (${root})/efi/sle/grub.efi ] ; then
+      chainloader (${root})/efi/sle/grub.efi

pull_request.title: Make SLE-Micro 5.4 boot via "local network boot"
pull_request.body:
This is a quick fix, a re-work of how OSes are booted from local disks to have a more general fitting code would be great. This would need some input from grub people and is a bigger change to be kept in mind for the future.
